sentences: Bruce Turgon (born 25 April 1952) is an American bass guitarist, guitarist, vocalist, songwriter and producer.
He and Gramm started the band Black Sheep in late 1971.
The Gramm-Turgon EP Stick Around  which later led the group to be signed to Capitol was released on Chrysalis in 1974.
The band released two albums in 1974 and was poised for major success when a car accident in 1975 damaged their equipment.
The band released two albums in 1974 and was poised for major success when a car accident in 1975 damaged their equipment.
Turgon co-wrote the song "My Way" along with Paul Stanley and Desmond Child for the platinum Kiss album Crazy Nights in 1987.
Turgon also contributed a song to the soundtrack for the horror film The Lost Boys (1987) titled: "Lost in the Shadows."

Gramm attempted to rejuvenate his solo career in 2003 with a band that included: Turgon on bass, Rocket Richotte on guitar, Kevin Neal on drums, John Purdell on keyboards (who suddenly died very early during the tour), and Gary Corbett on keyboards.
In between recording of Gramm’s second album Long Hard Look and its subsequent tour Turgon toured with Steve Stevens in support of his solo album Atomic Playboys (1989).

Turgon and Gramm formed the short-lived band Shadow King in 1991 along with guitarist Vivian Campbell (Dio, Whitesnake, Riverdogs and Def Leppard) and drummer Kevin Valentine (Godz, The Lou Gramm Band, Kiss, and Neverland.)
Although plans were made for a tour they performed only once-- at the Astoria Theatre in London, England, on December 13, 1991.
When Gramm rejoined Foreigner in 1992 Turgon was hired to play bass in place of the departing Rick Wills.
Foreigner then released their eighth studio album Mr. Moonlight in 1995--with several songs co-written by Turgon-- including the single "Until the End of Time."
Turgon released his first solo album in 2005.
The CD Now Is the Hour was released on January 23, 2009 on the Blistering Records label and featured former Endless Summer Beach Band member Philip Bardowell on lead vocals.
Stick Around EP (1974)
Black Sheep (1974)
Encouraging Words (1975)
Fighting For The Earth (1985)

The Lost Boys (film soundtrack; contributed one song, "Lost In The Shadows") (1987)

Highlander II: The Quickening (film soundtrack; contributed one song, "One Dream") (1991)
Mr. Moonlight (1994)
Outside Looking In (2005)
Now Is The Hour (2009)
10x10 ("One Good Reason") (2017)
Turgon has become increasingly involved in television, movie and documentary soundtrack work over the last ten years--contributing to shows on HBO, Showtime, PBS, and Warren Miller Films.
Black Sheep built a regional following over the next two years.
This caused them to lose the support-act-slot for Kiss that year.
Turgon co-wrote the song "My Way" along with Paul Stanley and Desmond Child for the platinum Kiss album Crazy Nights in 1987.
Turgon's long association with his friend Gramm led to writing and recording Gramm’s first solo album Ready or Not  which yielded the hit single: "Midnight Blue".
The single "Midnight Blue" was number one on the Hot Mainstream Rock Tracks.
Turgon recently worked on a collaboration album with Redding, California electronic musician Craig Padilla.
The CD Now Is the Hour was released on January 23, 2009 on the Blistering Records label and featured former Endless Summer Beach Band member Philip Bardowell on lead vocals.
Now Is The Hour (2009)
